Key Match Events: The Kings fell behind by 18 points early to a Dallas team missing Luka Doncic and Kyrie Irving
The Kings closed the third quarter on a 17-2 run and snapped a six-game losing streak
Pre-Game Insights: Doug Christie took over as the interim head coach of the Sacramento Kings amid a season-long losing streak, fans booing the team off their home court and questions surrounding the decision to fire Mike Brown
Post-Match Reflections: Christie said that building off the win will involve understanding that turning the season around is a process and wins are a byproduct
Miscellaneous Highlights: Christie's initial goals are incremental: Simplifying the offense in game one, followed by the defense in game two
Others: Christie wants the fans, who have endured 12 coaching changes since 2007 with just one playoff appearance, to know that they are appreciated, that theyâ€™ll put a product on the floor that makes them proud and that they can root for players who gave it their all
